newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Meralco gets nod on new rate structure.
newsitem.headline: Meralco gets nod on new rate structure.

text.p: The Manila Electric Co (Meralco) said on Wednesday it has received the approval of the Energy Regulatory Board (ERB) to restructure its power rates.
Meralco is the country's largest electricity distributor and the biggest customer of the state-run National Power Corp.
The new rate structure allows Meralco to reward efficient users of electricity with lower rates and impose higher fees on inefficient customers, the company said in a statement.
For instance, Meralco said industrial and non-industrial customers with load factors higher than 37 percent will enjoy lower rates.
Load factor refers to the degree of energy utilisation. Efficient usage increases with the load factor.
Meralco did not provide specifics on the new rate structure.
